title: Teaching

title: Research
text:
Interests: Analysis; Partial Differential Equations; Scattering Theory
Scattering theory is the study of perturbations on wave propagation. While highly applicable to physics (especially quantum mechanics), I am particularly interested in the underlying mathematics.

title: Jacob Lawrence
text:
I am a third year PhD student at the University of Missouri, advised by Tanya Christiansen. Broadly speaking, my research interests are in Partial Differential Equations, especially Spectral and Scattering Theory.
Before coming to UM, I completed a BS in Mathematics & Philosophy and an MA in Mathematics from the University of Alabama.
My CV can be found here.

Contact
Office: 20 Mathematical Sciences Building  Email (UM): jlqbx@missouri.edu  Email (personal): jtylawrence@outlook.com

title: Research
text:
Master’s Work
While doing my master’s degree, I completed a project on the sharp constants in the weak \((1,1)\) and strong \((p,p)\) inequalities for the Hardy-Littlewood Maximal Function. A copy of that paper can be found here. This was advised by Kabe Moen.

title: Projects
text:
Current
I am currently reading through chapters 2 and 3 of Mathematical Theory of Scattering Resonances by S. Dyatlov and M. Zworksi. Any notes and/or exercise I write will be found here.

title: Projects
text:
Past
In Summer 2025, I (partially) worked through Methods of Modern Mathematical Physics I: Functional Analysis by M. Reed and B. Simon. Some notes I have taken can be found here, and exercise I have completed can be found here.
